How to Install libprocps-dev on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • libprocps-dev

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install libprocps-dev on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing libprocps-dev on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall libprocps-dev in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install libprocps-dev, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install libprocps-dev Using apt

To install libprocps-dev in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install libprocps-dev using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install libprocps-dev

The installation of libprocps-dev might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install libprocps-dev Using apt-get

To install libprocps-dev using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install libprocps-dev.

sudo apt-get -y install libprocps-dev

Install libprocps-dev Using Synaptic

To install libprocps-dev using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install libprocps-dev on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for libprocps-dev. This will display the libprocps-dev package in the package window, now to install libprocps-dev, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the libprocps-dev package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of libprocps-dev.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install libprocps-dev Using aptitude

To install libprocps-dev on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of libprocps-dev.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install libprocps-dev using the command aptitude install libprocps-dev.

sudo aptitude -y install libprocps-dev

How to Upgrade libprocps-dev on debian

If you want to upgrade the libprocps-dev package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade libprocps-dev using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade libprocps-dev to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade libprocps-dev.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade libprocps-dev sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade libprocps-dev

Upgrade libprocps-dev using Aptitude

To upgrade libprocps-dev using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade libprocps-dev.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade libprocps-dev

Upgrade libprocps-dev using Synaptic

To upgrade libprocps-dev using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for libprocps-dev, now right-click libprocps-dev, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade libprocps-dev just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall libprocps-dev on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall libprocps-dev from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just libprocps-dev, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove libprocps-dev

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of libprocps-dev

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of libprocps-dev you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge libprocps-dev

Remove libprocps-dev using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall libprocps-dev using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for libprocps-dev, right-click the libprocps-dev package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall libprocps-dev click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install libprocps-dev on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade libprocps-dev using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of libprocps-dev then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
